GAME_ZIP64:
Kitronik blocks have the same colour settings

This is the :GAME ZIP64 Package
GAME_ZIP64.Strip.clear:
Turn off all LEDs.
You need to call ``show`` to make the changes visible.
GAME_ZIP64.Strip.setBrightness: Set the brightness of the strip. This flag only applies to future operation.
GAME_ZIP64.Strip.setBrightness|param|bri: a measure of LED brightness in 0-255. eg: 255
GAME_ZIP64.Strip.setMatrixColor:
Set LED to a given color (range 0-255 for r, g, b) in a matrix shaped strip 
You need to call ``show`` to make the changes visible.
GAME_ZIP64.Strip.setMatrixWidth: Sets the number of pixels in a matrix shaped strip
GAME_ZIP64.Strip.setMatrixWidth|param|wi: number of pixels in a row
GAME_ZIP64.Strip.setPin: Set the pin where the ZIP LED is connected, defaults to P0.
GAME_ZIP64.Strip.setPixelColor:
Set LED to a given color (range 0-255 for r, g, b). 
You need to call ``show`` to make the changes visible.
GAME_ZIP64.Strip.setPixelColor|param|pix: position of the ZIP LED in the strip
GAME_ZIP64.Strip.showColor: Shows all LEDs to a given color (range 0-255 for r, g, b).
GAME_ZIP64.ZIP64Display.clear:
Turn off all LEDs on the ZIP64 display.
You need to call ``show`` to make the changes visible.
GAME_ZIP64.ZIP64Display.setBrightness: Set the brightness of the ZIP64 display. This flag only applies to future operation.
GAME_ZIP64.ZIP64Display.setBrightness|pa: a measure of LED brightness in 0-255. eg: 255
GAME_ZIP64.ZIP64Display.setMatrixColor:
Set LED to a given color (range 0-255 for r, g, b) in the 8 x 8 matrix 
You need to call ``show`` to make the changes visible.
GAME_ZIP64.ZIP64Display.setPin: Set the pin where the ZIP LED is connected, defaults to P0.
GAME_ZIP64.ZIP64Display.show: Send all the changes to the ZIP64 display.
GAME_ZIP64.ZIP64Display.showColor: Shows whole ZIP64 display as a given color (range 0-255 for r, g, b).
GAME_ZIP64.ZipLedMode: Different modes for RGB or RGB+W ZIP strips
GAME_ZIP64.buttonIsPressed: Determines if a :GAME ZIP64 button is pressed
GAME_ZIP64.checkButtonPress: Input block for :GAME ZIP64 standard buttons
GAME_ZIP64.checkButtonPress|param|button: press to be checked, eg: Up
GAME_ZIP64.colors: Gets the RGB value of a known color
GAME_ZIP64.create: Create a new ZIP LED driver for `numleds` LEDs.
GAME_ZIP64.createZIP64Display: Create a new ZIP LED driver for :GAME ZIP64 Display.
GAME_ZIP64.create|param|numleds: number of leds in the strip, eg: 64
GAME_ZIP64.integer_position: Convert integer number to LED Position
GAME_ZIP64.onButtonPress: Do something when one of the :GAME ZIP64 Buttons is pressed
GAME_ZIP64.onButtonPress|param|event: happening on the button, eg: click
GAME_ZIP64.pixel_position: Convert 8x8 xy Coordinates to LED Position
GAME_ZIP64.rgb: Converts red, green, blue channels into a RGB color
GAME_ZIP64.rgb|param|blue: value of the blue channel between 0 and 255. eg: 255
GAME_ZIP64.rgb|param|green: value of the green channel between 0 and 255. eg: 255
GAME_ZIP64.rgb|param|red: value of the red channel between 0 and 255. eg: 255
GAME_ZIP64.runMotor: Run vibration motor for a particular length of time
GAME_ZIP64.runMotor|param|run_time: is the length of time the motor will run in ms, eg: 100
GAME_ZIP64.setBuzzerPin: Setup micro:bit to play music through buzzer
GAME_ZIP64.x_value: Convert integer position number to x coordinate
GAME_ZIP64.y_value: Convert integer position number to y coordinate
ZipLedColors: Well known colors for a ZIP strip
